LanguageData.JRWBrachytrachelopan.label: Brachytrachelopan
LanguageData.JRWBrachytrachelopan.description:
-- > INGEN INTERNAL CASE FILE #03927-2005 [Brachytrachelopan mesai] CODENAME: OKAPI >4837
A short necked sauropod that has developed some interesting features due to genetic splicing. Instead of a strictly herbivorous diet these dinosaurs have developed a long, sticky tongue for lapping up insects and large, sharp thumbs for climbing and embedding into trees, rocks and nests belonging to invertebrates like termites and ants. They have developed a strong rivalry of sorts with Termitotron vendeese, an artifical grudge match that has lasted throughout the ages as these one manufactured creatures have spread into the wild.
LanguageData.JRWBrachytrachelopan.tools.head.label: head
